paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses breast cancer risks associated with missense variants in several genes, including BRCA2. It provides statistical analysis and penetrance data for these variants.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 variants were annotated using homology-directed DNA repair (HDR) assay scores and predictions of pathogenicity.

variants.additional_notes: The paper mentions that a small subset of rare missense variants in BRCA2 gives similar risk to those of protein truncating variants.
key_quotes: For ATM, BRCA1, and BRCA2, data were compatible with small subsets (approximately 7%, 2%, and 0.6%, respectively) of rare missense variants giving similar risk to those of protein truncating variants in the same gene.

tables_processed.table_caption: Breast cancer risk association results from logistic regression and mixture models of population training samples

challenges: Limited specific variant data for BRCA2 in the text
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper provides aggregate data for BRCA2 but lacks specific variant details and individual-level penetrance information.
